intro: Bryonia dioica subsp. angulosa, commonly known as the angular bryony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit and possesses spiny stems with angular ridges. The plant produces yellow,瓠-shaped fruits that contain toxic seeds, and its leaves are alternate and palmately lobed. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in hedgerows, wastelands, and along roadsides. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
